bill.title: Relating To Fireworks Labeling.
bill.description: Corrects the labeling dimensions for a label affixed to display fireworks from nine inches by nine inches to nine square inches. (SD1)

referrals.name: Public Safety, Intergovernmental and Military Affairs

history.action: Pending introduction.
Introduced and Pass First Reading.
Referred to CPC, referral sheet 3
Bill scheduled to be heard by CPC on Tuesday, 02-05-19 2:00PM in House conference room 329.

The committees on CPC recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 10 Ayes: Representative(s) Takumi, Ichiyama, Belatti, Cabanilla Arakawa, Cachola, Har, Kong, Mizuno, Onishi, Matsumoto; Ayes with reservations: none; 0 Noes: none; and 1 Excused: Representative(s) Aquino.
Reported from CPC (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 930) as amended in HD 1, recommending passage on Second Reading and placement on the calendar for Third Reading.
Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1; placed on the calendar for Third Reading with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) DeCoite excused (1).
Passed Third Reading with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Cabanilla Arakawa, Quinlan excused (2). Transmitted to Senate.
Received from House (Hse. Com. No. 386).
Passed First Reading.
Referred to PSM, CPH.
The committee(s) on PSM has scheduled a public hearing on 03-19-19 1:20PM in conference room 229.

The committee(s) on PSM recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes in PSM were as follows: 3 Aye(s): Senator(s) Nishihara, Wakai, Baker; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 2 Excused: Senator(s) Harimoto, Fevella.
Reported from PSM (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 1411) with recommendation of passage on Second Reading and referral to CPH.
Report adopted; Passed Second Reading and referred to CPH.
The committee(s) on CPH will hold a public decision making on 03-28-19 9:30AM in conference room 229.

The committee(s) on CPH recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in CPH were as follows: 5 Aye(s): Senator(s) Baker, J.Keohokalole, Nishihara, Ruderman, L. Thielen; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 2 Excused: Senator(s) S. Chang, Fevella.
Reported from CPH (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 1862) with recommendation of passage on Third Reading, as amended (SD 1).
48 Hrs. Notice 04-09-19.
Report adopted; Passed Third Reading, as amended (SD 1). Ayes, 25; Aye(s) with reservations: none . Noes, 0 (none). Excused, 0 (none). Transmitted to House.
Returned from Senate (Sen. Com. No. 746) in amended form (SD 1).
House disagrees with Senate amendment (s).
Received notice of disagreement (Hse. Com. No. 804).
Senate Conferees Appointed: Nishihara Chair; Baker Co-Chair; Fevella.
Received notice of Senate conferees (Sen. Com. No. 950).
Reconsideration of action taken on 04-11-19.
Received notice of House reconsideration of action in disagreeing to the amendments proposed by the Senate (Hse. Com. No. 855).
House agrees to Senate amendment(s).
Passed Final Reading as amended in SD 1 with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Holt excused (1).
Received notice of House agreement and passage on Final Reading (Hse. Com. No. 859).
Transmitted to Governor.
